current_actions.suggested_language: Your Honor, at this time we'd like to introduce Plaintiff's Exhibit 103, the Sample Corporation Wire Transfer Policy.
current_actions.rationale: Documentary evidence directly contradicts witness testimony on board approval requirements
current_actions.risk_tradeoff: Strong foundation established through witness testimony

current_actions.suggested_language: Mr. Smith, just to be clear - you authorized all three wire transfers to Offshore Holdings, correct?
current_actions.rationale: Lock in admission before redirect provides opportunity to muddy the waters
current_actions.risk_tradeoff: Low risk - witness already acknowledged authorization

current_actions.suggested_language: Note for closing: Witness admitted knowing the deposits were just under $10,000 and called it 'coincidental'
current_actions.rationale: Strong quote for closing argument - jury will remember 'coincidental'

completed_actions.suggested_language: Mr. Smith, in your deposition on December 15th, 2023, you stated you had never seen deposits in these amounts. Do you recall that testimony?
completed_actions.actual_outcome: Witness admitted prior inconsistent statement; attempted weak rehabilitation

completed_actions.suggested_language: Exhibit 103 shows the corporate policy requires board approval for any foreign transfers. How do you reconcile that?
completed_actions.actual_outcome: Witness contradicted himself again; credibility severely damaged

available_impeachment.trigger_condition: If witness claims no knowledge of beneficial owners

deposition_reference.text: I understood the principals were overseas investors

available_impeachment.notes: May not arise - save for cross if needed

objection_opportunities.context: If redirect uses leading questions to rehabilitate
objection_opportunities.recommendation: Use sparingly - only on clearly improper questions

alerts.message: Witness credibility below 30 - optimal time for settlement leverage
